intro: Willughbeia borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean willughbeia, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as an understory tree or shrub, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Willughbeia borneensis plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
